text: Is there possibly a major issue with file caching in the COS. We have different people working on different files at different times, but the interface often does not show the latest file unless we do a HARD REFRESH every time. Is there a way to prevent this, i.e. a setting to never cache files? When working with multiple team members facing deadlines we do not always think that the system might be loading a cached version of the file and not the latest version. Any work arounds or recommendations out there?
what do you mean by "workign with files"
as in people are uploading a file and the person working on the page doesn't see the new file?
Personally, to not have any errors with caching, I delete the original file before uploading -- then there are no cache issues for me <@U26CZR9MW>
When editing files in the template builder i.e. <https://app.HubSpot.com/content/19xxxxx/template-builder/code/43xxxxxxx>
oh.
I would hard refresh every time you are entering a file
if you aren't using source control, you should hard refresh every time. Communicate inside instant messages
doesn't seem the COS is well suited to multi-dev.
Build out items in modules that way you have one person in a module at a time
those are all things you can do to eliminate the need to have two people in a template

<@U25PYL3Q8> we never have two people in one file. The issue is if I work on a style sheet or .js or html file (for example) on Monday, and a team member works on it Tuesday and Wednesday. When I go back in to work on it on Thursday (or simliar scenario) it loads the cached file, and not the latest file. Why?
Did you have the design manager open for three days?
Like -- you save it on monday
then you leave that window there until thursday
And then start editing on thursday
That will have your changes you made
and no one elses
Our Teams have an SOP that the design manager is closed immediately after your task is done.

The design manager is usually open, or another area like content, blog or forms, but all files worked on and saved have been closed. They are then reopened when getting back to work on the files for that project.
Is is possible to add a setting to the <https://app.HubSpot.com/content/1xxxxx/settings/publishing> to disable/enable all caching? Thanks for the help and insight :wink:
Yeah, I refresh every time I am in design manager. Its a web app. Refresh is your friend
a simple keyboard shortcut also depending on your browser of choice

Quick general question. I need to tweak a clients blog listing. The only problem is I dont want to make changes to the live site, is there a way to quickly clone the HS Blog and place it on another domain for testing?
I've nevern been able to do that
you have to create a new blog
and then create blog posts inside of it
ugh that is what I was afraid of lol
at least, that is my method
If there is a better way, I'm hopingsomeone has it
I would say I could do it all through the preview by cloning the template, issue is I have to make mods to "Page 2" of the blog listing and you can't preview that with a template :disappointed:
yeah the author and other stuff it is difficult to preview
not all of the stuff makes perfect sense in translation either

anyway to do the equivalent of blocking access to the site (similar to an .htacess allow/disallow) with a blog. We dont want the blog to be visibile outside a certain IP and only used for dev (not indexing in the search engines).
I dont think there is but just curious if anyone has done it
you can add robots directives in site settings. Other than that, just don't share the link :slightly_smiling_face:
Yeah, Content > content settings - search on page for robot
